title: Frontier Pioneer Language
description: Head west with the vocabulary of American pioneers and frontier settlers

questions.question: On the American frontier, what was a 'prairie schooner'?
options: A covered wagon used by pioneers traveling west

questions.question: In pioneer vocabulary, what was a 'soddy'?
options: A house built from blocks of prairie sod

questions.question: What did 'manifest destiny' mean to frontier Americans?
options: The belief that American expansion across the continent was justified and inevitable

questions.question: On the frontier, what was a 'homesteader'?
options: A person who claimed and settled on public land under the Homestead Act

questions.question: What was a 'corral' on the American frontier?
In frontier terminology, what was a 'stampede'?
options: A sudden panicked rush of animals or people

questions.question: What did 'teetotaler' mean on the frontier?
options: A person who completely abstained from alcohol

questions.question: In pioneer vocabulary, what was a 'lean-to'?
options: A simple shelter with a sloping roof propped against a wall or tree

questions.question: What was a 'trading post' on the American frontier?
options: A fence post for tying horses
A store where settlers and Native Americans exchanged goods

questions.question: In frontier language, what did 'to stake out' originally mean?
options: To mark the boundaries of a land claim with stakes

questions.question: What was 'jerky' in pioneer food vocabulary?
options: Dried and preserved strips of meat

questions.question: On the frontier, what was a 'dugout'?
options: A dwelling partially dug into a hillside

questions.question: In pioneer language, what was a 'circuit rider'?
options: A traveling preacher who rode between frontier communities

questions.question: What was a 'barn raising' on the American frontier?
options: A communal event where neighbors gathered to build a barn together
